Half Life 2 is a true masterpiece of a game, with beautiful graphics (even though it was released in 2004) and thrilling gameplay, with a large variety of different situations to fight through. Half Life 2 excels wherever Half Life falls a bit short, with a gripping atmosphere created by superb gameplay and graphics. Every chapter is a diverse piece of art that is a joy to play through. This is definitely a game that you need to play.

C'mon now, there is no reason to leave a bad review

I last played this games 14 years ago and still pined to replay it again after all these years. Best decision I made. Yes! I would recommend to other players due its stunning graphics, adrenaline inducing action and excitement throughout the story line. Of course, the best aspect of the game would be its level of interactivity, forcing the player to think creatively through some problem solving.

Half-Life 2, what a game! First played it in 2018, still holds up today. The graphics have aged, and the controls feel a bit weird, but this is where the standards of modern game began.

Worth a buy even 15+ years later.

HALF LIFE 2

Following the first game, you are transported to City 17, a place where humans are being oppressed by their new alien rulers. You get to see the impact that your actions from the first game made on the world. Eventually, you find your pals from Black Mesa and begin your journey through the City to reunite with a team that can help you put a stop to the oppression.

Graphics still hold up well, source engine physics (when not bonking out) work great, and the story is compelling with very few boring moments. Play the first Half Life though (or Black Mesa), or you'll be lost as to what is going on.

10/10
